1.text: And Man knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bore Cain, and said, I have acquired a man with Jehovah.

2.text: And she further bore his brother Abel. And Abel was a shepherd, but Cain was a husbandman.

3.text: And in process of time it came to pass that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering to Jehovah.

4.text: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock, and of their fat. And Jehovah looked upon Abel, and on his offering;

5.text: and upon Cain, and on his offering, he did not look. And Cain was very angry, and his countenance fell.

6.text: And Jehovah said to Cain, Why art thou angry, and why is thy countenance fallen?

7.text: If thou doest well, will not [thy countenance] look up [with confidence]? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door; and unto thee [shall be] his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

8.text: And Cain spoke to Abel his brother, and it came to pass when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

9.text: And Jehovah said to Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: am I my brother’s keeper?

10.text: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother’s blood is crying to me from the ground.

11.text: And now be thou cursed from the ground, which hath opened its mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand.

12.text: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield thee its strength; a wanderer and fugitive shalt thou be on the earth.

13.text: And Cain said to Jehovah, My punishment is too great to be borne.

14.text: Behold, thou hast driven me this day from the face of the ground, and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a wanderer and fugitive on the earth; and it will come to pass, [that] every one who finds me will slay me.

15.text: And Jehovah said to him, Therefore, whoever slayeth Cain, it shall be revenged sevenfold. And Jehovah set a mark on Cain, lest any finding him should smite him.

16.text: And Cain went out from the presence of Jehovah, and dwelt in the land of Nod, toward the east of Eden.

17.text: And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. And he built a city; and he called the name of the city after the name of his son Enoch.

18.text: And to Enoch was born Irad; and Irad begot Mehujael; and Mehujael begot Methushael; and Methushael begot Lemech.

19.text: And Lemech took two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the second, Zillah.

20.text: And Adah bore Jabal: he was the father of those who dwell in tents, and [breed] cattle.

21.text: And his brother’s name was Jubal: he was the father of those who handle the harp and pipe.

22.text: And Zillah, she also bore Tubal-Cain, the forger of every kind of tool of brass and iron. And the sister of Tubal-Cain was Naamah.

23.text: And Lemech said to his wives: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice, Ye wives of Lemech, listen to my speech. For I have slain a man for my wound, and a youth for my bruise.

24.text: If Cain shall be avenged seven-fold; Lemech seventy and seven fold.

25.text: And Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son, and called his name Seth:... For God has appointed me another seed instead of Abel, because Cain has slain him.

26.text: And to Seth, to him also was born a son; and he called his name Enosh. Then people began to call on the name of Jehovah.
